level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 01
level.desc: This level looks like an early version of level 5-3. It has the Kuribo's Goomba, Spinies and the connecting pipes. The main differences to the final version are the fact that you start out on the left side of the map ... and the existence of multiple connecting pipes, as opposed to only one in the final. --TCRF

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 02
level.desc: This level doesn't really resemble anything in the game. It looks most like 3-9, with the pipes connecting to a water area, though the enemy setup is completely different. However, the ending is particularly strange: You appear out of nowhere, and if you attempt to go into the pipe right in front of you, you'll arrive in a Coin Heaven [NOTE: 3-7's coin heaven] which leads to a treasure box containing a Jugem's Cloud. To find the real exit, you must fly over the pipe and the blue structure. --TCRF

level.name: UNUSED CORRUPT/RUINS
level.desc: An interesting corrupt ruin of an underground level. It is 'valid' in terms of having a good header and none of its layout elements appear to be invalid, but it does appear to be mostly misplaced. This was probably a very early level and components changed without it being updated.

level.name: UNUSED PIPE JCT 1
level.desc: Appears to be an early pipe junction area; kind of narrow. Also has the characteristic 'orange' color of early/unused underground areas. Further suggests that all underground levels were probably originally in this bank.

level.name: UNUSED PIPE JCT 2
level.desc: Appears to be an early pipe junction area; same as UNUSED PIPE JCT 1

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 03
level.desc: This hilly level with Lakitu and several continuous Starmen is most likely an early version of 7-3. It's interesting how a Kuribo's Goomba is there; the developer team likely wanted the Kuribo's Shoe to appear in other levels beside 5-3, but for some reason, this never happened. --TCRF

level.name: W7-3

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 04
level.desc: This UNUSED LEVEL appears to be a more challenging version of 1-5, with the Piranha Plants awaiting you at the foot of all the slopes and most importantly the lack of a Coin Heaven. Also, note how the programmers made a big door by putting two doors side-by-side. --TCRF

level.desc: Dreadful Donut Lifts. If you collect 28 or more coins here, you can get the White Mushroom House to appear.

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 11
level.desc: This level appears to be an early version of 1-6. The major change is the lack of line following platforms (there are two platforms but they only go back and forth). There are also some more enemies. --TCRF

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 12
level.desc: This is yet another version of 1-6, but is much more incomplete. It does not even have a goal, so your only choice to end the level is to fall into the pit. The starting position is also weird, as it's way above the ground. --TCRF

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 13
level.desc: This is the same as [UNUSED LEVEL 12]... well, almost. The ground has been lowered by one block and you no longer start somewhere in mid-air. --TCRF

tileset.name: Plant Infestation

level.desc: Grr... Mario, I ain't feelin' too good today. My hair looks terrible and I can't be bothered wit' you.

level.name: W3 Airship Boss

level.name: W4 Airship Intro

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 09
level.desc: This rather bland level features blocks moving up and down and Parabeetles, including the unused green variant. The Parabeetles are used in only one level in the final version, so it's possible that the developers wanted to include them in a few more.

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 14
level.desc: This level is odd. It has no exit, and no enemies at all. It also has weird black stuff at the top of screen, which may have been intended to be a starry background. --TCRF

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 15
level.desc: This [has] stacked cloud platforms (that are never seen outside of this stage) [and] the Bullet Bill cannon present in this level will never fire, either. --TCRF ** NOTE: They linked this level's object set to the World 1 Hammer Brother battle, hence why TCRF describes it as possibly having been a hammer bro battle area. But there's nothing that actually makes this link, so I suspect there is no object set at all. Just maybe a test for stacked clouds that never made it anywhere.

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 03 Coin Heaven
level.desc: UNUSED LEVEL 3's Coin Heaven

level.name: UNUSED LEVEL 10
level.desc: It is definitely supposed to be some kind of Coin Heaven, but it may or may not have been intended to house enemies. -- TCRF ** NOTE: They linked this level's object set to the same one used in UNUSED LEVEL 9, but nothing definitively links it, so I don't think it belonged here.

tileset.name: Underground
tileset.desc: First seen in 1-5. Contains blocks to support underground levels, including 'above ground' and 'below ground' tiles.

level.name: W3-4
level.desc: Automatic Unlimited Lives Equals A 1-Up Factory! NOTE: I realize this is totally not an 'underground' level, but it's in the Underground level bank, so deal.

level.name: W3-8
level.desc: Tidal Terror! You have to get to the safety vines fast! NOTE: I realize this is totally not an 'underground' level, but it's in the Underground level bank, so deal.

level.name: W5-2
level.desc: Choices, Choices... This world gives you a choice of paths to take, but you'll have to move quickly to take the easier one.

level.name: W6-8
level.desc: Rough And Tumble Tundra NOTE: I realize this is totally not an 'underground' level, but it's in the Underground level bank, so deal.

level.name: W8-2
level.desc: An Essential Shortcut. There is a secret passage ... that will take you through to almost the end of the stage.

level.name: EMPTY UNDERGROUND 1+
level.desc: There are *35* empty/unused underground level slots! I'm just listing this one for 1-35, because they're all identical, and I think users would be nuts with 30+ useless items... but clean those out if you plan on making some room! Also remove the 'Plains' duplicate data!
